data.title: Exclusive Early Peek at *Vanity Fair’*s Young Hollywood, Starring . . . Sarah Silverman!
data.meta_description:
Dear Judd,
I’d love to help with your magazine project, but I am unable to for several reasons.
data.text:
Dear Judd,

I’d love to help with your magazine project, but I am unable to for several reasons.

I’m really, really busy and really, really popular. So right off the bat, that’s a tough squeeze time-wise.

I can’t say I’m familiar with this publication, unless it’s connected to the super-fancy paper-plate-and-plasticware company I love so much. Still, I’m sure you understand I can’t be writing art for a paper-plate-company magazine.

O.K. I just Googled it and I do know this magazine—and as it turns out I have a big beef with them. Whenever they have a young-up-and-coming-movie-starlets-of-tomorrow cover, I’m blatantly snubbed. Am I not good enough to lounge in a vintage gown from the 1930s, lazily draped on a chaise, pretending to be in the same room as 14 other cut-and-pasted actresses in similar garb and furniture and poses? I was born to do that, and this magazine took that from me and continues to take that from me with every passing year. And why? Why am I repeatedly overlooked? Because I’m a polarizing Jew? Or is it because of what we all know but are afraid to say: I’m just too goddamned pretty?

We may never know, but what I do know is this: You will have to do your comedy-issue curating sans me. I hope this doesn’t hurt sales too much.

Sincerely,

Sarah Jane Anastasia Silverman XIV

PS: Mark Brazill was right.

Politics

Donald Trump Has Nothing Else

When the ex-president is desperate, he gets stuck on the 2020 election—and racist taunts.

Politics

How Trumpworld Is Coping With the Kamala Harris Boom

In just days, the vice president has raked in more than $100 million, scored countless endorsements, started a social media phenomenon, and secured enough delegates for the nomination. “She has been totally dominating,” marveled one GOP strategist.

Television

Angry House of the Dragon Fans Claim One Gay Kiss Has “Ruined” the Series

The episode “Smallfolk” has received an overwhelming number of one-star reviews, with many citing a passionate moment between Rhaenyra and Mysaria.

Politics

Tucker Carlson Portrays Donald Trump, of All People, as Trying to “Return Democracy to the United States”

The right-wing talker once privately mocked the former president’s stolen election claims. But on stage Thursday night at the Republican National Convention, Carlson lauded Trump as a “responsible” and “unifying” leader who could bring a fractured nation back together.

Award Season

For Lessons in Chemistry, Brie Larson Learned How to Experiment

She couldn’t quite crack brilliant scientist Elizabeth Zott for the Emmy-nominated show until she had her own epiphany.

Television

J.D. Vance’s Mythical Couch Tryst Is a Fact-Checker’s Nightmare. Stephen Colbert Explains Why.

During his Late Show monologue, Colbert roasted Donald Trump’s running mate for the untrue (?) sofa-billy elegy currently delighting the internet.

Hollywood

Harvey Weinstein to Face New Sexual Assault Trial in November

Prosecutors in Manhattan might bring new accusations against the previously convicted former movie mogul.

Celebrity

Jennifer Aniston Slams J.D. Vance’s Resurfaced Remarks About “Childless Cat Ladies”

Aniston, who has been candid about her own struggle to conceive, also criticized Trump’s running mate for voting against the Right to IVF Act: “Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.”

Politics

Democrats Are Having Fun?

They just had to listen to voters.

Style

Ballerina Farm Influencer Hannah Neeleman Says She Doesn’t “Identify” as a Trad Wife

The Mrs. World competitor and mother of 8 says she doesn’t know “what feminism means any more” but said the one epidural she ever had was “kinda great.”
